intro: Lophogyne varians, commonly known as the variable lophogyne, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals. It typically grows as an understory shrub in moist, shaded habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
